result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian J Czecholinski was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 153 days credit.
AMENDED 10-30-2015:  Apply 150 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Waukesha County Case 14CF725

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of Extended Supervision.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Case 14CT1405 is dismissed and read-in.
Cash bail applied.  COSTS/SURCHARGES ARE PAID IN FULL.  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

Cash bail applied.  Balance of fine to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision (can be taken out of prison wages).

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brian J Czecholinski in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Robert J. Penegor.   
Case called along with:   14CT1405 & 14CF725

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilt of count 1.
Counts 2 - 4 are dismissed as read ins.
Count 5 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 4 Years.
Initial Confinement: 2 Years.
Extended Supervision: 2 Years.
Concurrent :  Waukesha County Case14CF725.
153 Days Credit.

36 Months D/L REVOCATION.
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department);
FINE:  $1,519
DNA Sample and Surchare:  $250
Apply bail from 14CF725.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages).

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant to be transferred to DCI.
